Class HexEditorService

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.services.HexEditorService
@Component public class HexEditorService extends Object
A service that manages various changes that will be applied to a file. All operations against the file will be done through this service, which is backed by a LazyHexList.

The changes are stored in a List as HexRowChange objects in this order: UPDATE, REMOVE, INSERT, APPEND. Within each of the first three groups, the changes are sorted in ascending order by row and then by column. Only one APPEND change is allowed.

Changes can be added via the main window or the Embed Message window. They can be viewed or removed from the service via the View All Changes window.
See Also:
  • ChangeType
  • EmbedMessageWindowController
  • HexRowChange
  • LazyHexList
  • MainWindowController
  • AllChangesWindowController

    • HexEditorService

  • Method Details

    • queueChange

      public void queueChange(HexRowChange change)
      Queues up the given change. All UPDATE changes are grouped together first, followed by REMOVE changes, then INSERT changes, and lastly a single APPEND change. Within each group, the changes are sorted in ascending order by row and then by column.

      If there is already a change in the list that is of the same change type and has the same row index, column index, and data as the incoming change, the method will simply return.

      Only one APPEND change can be in the list. If there is already one, the existing one will be removed so the incoming APPEND change can be added to the end of the list.
      Parameters:
      change - A change that will be performed against a file upon save.

    • saveChanges

      public void saveChanges()
      Processes all the queued changes. After a REMOVE change is applied, the index of each subsequent REMOVE change will be decremented by one. After an INSERT change is applied, the index of each subsequent INSERT change will be incremented by one. Because the number of bytes in the file will change after either an INSERT or REMOVE change is applied, the index past the end of the file for an APPEND change, if present, will need to be updated. Finally, the list containing all the queued changes will be cleared before the method returns.

    • getChangeQueue

      public List<HexRowChange> getChangeQueue()
      Returns a list of queued changes.
      Returns:
      A list of queued changes.

    • discardAllChanges

      public void discardAllChanges()
      Clears the list of queued changes.

    • undoMostRecentChange

      public void undoMostRecentChange()
      Undoes the most recent change.

    • setHexList

      public void setHexList(LazyHexList hexList)
      Sets an instance of a LazyHexList object.
      Parameters:
      hexList - An instance of a LazyHexList.

    • getRow

      public HexRow getRow(int row, boolean shouldGetChange)
      Returns a chunk of data at the given row index from a backing LazyHexList. If shouldGetChange is true, a chunk of data at the given row index in the list of queued changes will be returned instead.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index at which to retrieve a chunk of data.
      shouldGetChange - True to retrieve data from a queued change at the given row index, false to retrieve data from the backing LazyHexList.
      Returns:
      A HexRow containing a chunk of data.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the file offset that is calculated using the given row index is negative, or greater than or equal to the file size.

    • getNumberOfRows

      public int getNumberOfRows()
      Returns the number of rows of data in the backing LazyHexList.
      Returns:
      The number of rows of data in the backing LazyHexList or zero if the backing object is null.

    • getLastRowIndex

      public int getLastRowIndex()
      Returns the index of the last row of data in the backing LazyHexList.
      Returns:
      The index of the last row of data in the backing LazyHexList or -1 if the backing object is null.

    • isEmptyFile

      public boolean isEmptyFile()
      Returns true if the backing LazyHexList is null or empty; false if the object contains elements.
      Returns:
      True if the backing LazyHexList is null or empty; false otherwise.

    • getLastByteIndex

      public long getLastByteIndex()
      Returns the index of the last byte in the file.
      Returns:
      The index of the last byte in the file.

    • getTotalBytesIncludingQueuedChanges

      public long getTotalBytesIncludingQueuedChanges()
      Returns the total number of bytes in the file, which includes bytes that will be inserted into or removed from the file.
      Returns:
      The total number of bytes in the file.
